text: Candi Sari (Candi Bendan) is a Buddhist temple about 567 meters north of Kalasan temple in Yogyakarta region of Indonesia. It was built in the 8th century during old Mataram kingdom. The two-storey structure of Candi Sari temple was supposed to be a vihara (Buddhist monastery) and residence for the monks. == Gallery == Image:Candi-sari 09N7994.jpg|Candi Sari, rear view.
